VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_5x5_S16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_5x5_S16 (const int16_t *restrict im, int32_t width, int32_t height, int16_t thresh, uint8_t *restrict out)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_5x5_S16 ( const int16_t *restrict  im,
int32_t  width,
int32_t  height,
int16_t  thresh,
uint8_t *restrict  out 
)

Description
This function compares the value of each input pixel against its neighbors. For an output pixel to be "on" (numerical value=255), the input pixel value must be both:
  • Greater than or equal to its neighbors values
  • Greater than the minimum threshold
If the above conditions are not met simultaneously, the output will be 0.
The function processes only valid non-border pixels of the input and this results in the output being cropped to have only (width - 4) x (height - 4) valid pixels. Border thickness is two pixels as the window size used is 5x5. Also, as the first output pixel is obtained by processing the first valid non-border input pixel, there is a shift in the output image with respect to the input image. The shift is two pixels to the left and two pixels to the top. The shift can be avoided by passing the pointer to the third pixel of the third row of output as the argument out to the function. Since the output is cropped, its border pixels do not contain valid data. If the shift is avoided, the output border pixels are invalid. If the shift is not avoided, four rightmost columns and four bottommost rows of the output do not contain valid data. See Output Shift by Filtering Functions for more information.
Parameters:
[in] *im Input image (SQ15.0)
[in] width Image width (SQ31.0)
[in] height Image height (SQ31.0)
[in] thresh Minimum threshold for peaks (SQ15.0)
[out] *out Binary output indicating peaks (UQ8.0)
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
